title: InvalidParameter id
content:
Hi, saw this msg the first time yesterday. I am on Debian with Thunderbird 115.15.0 (64-bit)

I get this msg at startup: <yellow triangle with exclamation mark> Alert from account <existing account name written here>: <some code with letters, numbers, punctuation> InvalidParameter id: <same code again>_CFR_1

I don't know if the <same code again> is specific to my email account, so I did not write that here. Can't find any post on this InvalidParameter id.

I did not reconfigure that particular email account or changed any config in Thunderbird, besides what regular updates bring.

I have removed the email account from Thunderbird and reconfigured it, same msg. I could recreate the email account on the hosting side, but before I do that I wanted to see if there is more info about this problem, to avoid with other accounts in the future, maybe there is something preventive I can do ...

Thanks for any idea.

title: SMTP/Sending Emails just stopped working
content:
Hi there - been using Thunderbird for donkeys (since it was Eudora!). A few weeks back I started to get messages from Microsoft that I needed to change security settings as they were no longer supported on 3rd party email handlers like Thunderbird. So I re-created the three accounts I had there and it seemed to be OK, though SMTP did not have the OAUTH2 option available ... and when I tried to use the new SMTPs they wouldn't work. So I reverted to the old settings there and it worked again.

But this morning, with the big update to Thunderbird Nebula, I can no longer send emails from the MS accounts. My Gmail one is still OK ... but whatever I try, I cannot get the MS ones to send emails - I get a failure connecting.

Login to server smtp-mail.outlook.com with username xxxxx@hotmail.com failed.

I checked on MS and the details shown there:

SMTP server name smtp-mail.outlook.com SMTP port 587 SMTP encryption STARTTLS Authentication Method OAuth2/Modern Auth

Are what I have (I did have a different SMTP Server name came up - smtp.office365.com - but that doesn't work either)

So ... where is the issue? Is this a bug in the new Thunderbird setup? Something else? I don't know where to go ...

David
creator: david854

title: Accepting non-English characters as being part of words in personal dictionary
content:
I use a land acknowledgement in my signature file, and it contains many non-English symbols. For example, I live now where many hən̓q̓əmin̓əm̓-speaking peoples first lived, and I have it set up so that Thunderbird does a spelling check before messages get sent. However, despite adding "hən̓q̓əmin̓əm̓" to my personal dictionary, the spell-checker will not treat the word as one word and insists on breaking it up into "hən̓", "əmin̓", and "əm̓" as being the parts that are misspelled. The weirdest part is that it doesn't even see the "q̓" as being potentially misspelled either.

How do I get Thunderbird to accept the whole word as an actual word in my personal dictionary and ignore it every time I send a message?
creator: TLRS

title: Malfunzionamento Thunderbird con hotmail
content: Salve sto riscontrando problemi di autenticazione di thunderbird sulla posta hotmail. S.O Windows 10 pro aggiornatoa 22H2; versione thunderbird 128.2.3esr (32 bit). Fino a giorno 24 settembre funzionava benissimo adesso invece mi da errore "Accesso al server pop-mail.outlook.com con nome utente pctechgela@hotmail.it non riuscito" faccio riprova e alla fine si blocca su "Invio del nome utente non riuscito. Il server di posta pop-mail.outlook.com ha risposto: Logon failure: unknown user name or bad password". Ho provato a mettere come autenticazione l'opzione 0auth2 si apre una finestra bianca che scompare dopo alcuni secondi e alla fine restituisce "Autenticazione non riuscita..." La Password è corretta in quanto accedo tranquillamente da browser e da dispositivo android sia con app generica sia con app outlook.

title: OAuth2
content:
Hello. I was using your wonderful mail client with the parameters Outgoing Mail Server SMTP 

- Authentication method: regular password. And everything worked until Microsoft implemented OAuth2.

Read the instructions carefully: https://support.mozilla.org/ru/kb/autentifikaciya-microsoft-oauth-i-thunderbird-v-2024

Everything is described in detail there, I was also able to activate the “Security Setting” - OAuth2, but on the step where I need to change the settings of the Outgoing SMTP Mail Server from “Regular Password” to “OAuth2” - I was not able to do it, because in my settings there is no “OAuth2” parameter.

I also tried creating a new account for the new mail, but when I created it, I was also missing the “OAuth2” setting. I have the latest version of Thunderbird 128.2.3esr (64-bit) installed.

Dear technical support, please provide me the easiest solution so that I can continue to use my mail client.

Have a nice day!
creator: absentia8

title: logon failure
content: I have Thunderbird software version 128.2.3esr (64-bit). I have 5 email address accounts 1 with google.com and 4 with outlook.com. All work perfect except 1 of the outlook.com accounts. All the outlook.com accounts are configured the same (settings, account settings etc). The error message is always "pop3.server3.2: Got an error name=pop3PasswordFailed, the server said: Logon failure: unknown user name or bad password. 2 Pop3Client.sys.mjs:1576:18".I did not change passwords. In fact, I can go on internet to outlook.com email logon web page and access the email account perfectly, even though it fails everytime with Thunderbird. (it still is same password, never changed). Plese help, I have spent some time trying to solve on my own.
creator: bw.extra
